title: Retribution
opening: Amid riots in Hrym territory, Ferdinand learns that his missing father, Duke Aegir, has been found. Lysithea, who knows the area well, goes with him to investigate.

intro.speaker: Duke Aegir
intro.line: Can't...stop...running...

intro.speaker: Duke Aegir
intro.line: Wha--?!

intro.speaker: Rogue A
intro.line: We got you! You're the prime minister, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Rogue B
intro.line: Not anymore. He lost his power and his fancy title. Now he's just a man.

intro.speaker: Rogue C
intro.line: Shut up!

intro.speaker: Rogue A
intro.line: Yeah! Do you know what you've done to regular folks like us? Since you villains took over the Hrym territory, our lives have been nothing but pain and misery! Heavy taxes, forced labor. It's brutal!

intro.speaker: Rogue D
intro.line: Now we're gonna make you pay!

intro.speaker: Duke Aegir
intro.line: Agh! Argh! Aaaaaaaargh!

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Hm, such a nice selection of tea leaves in the pantry here.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: Tea is nice and all, but it's not much good when you don't have sweets to go with it.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Sweet treats are less common, yes, but perhaps that makes sense. War is not sugar-coated.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: If you've got time to be cheeky, you've got time to find me some sweets.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: But Lysithea, your smile is so sweet--

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: Lord Ferdinand! Excuse the interruption. Our scouts happened upon the information you were looking for. I thought it would be best to let you know as soon as possible.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: They know where my father is?!

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Tell me, now.

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: After losing his position as prime minister, your father was held in Enbarr for a very long time. He escaped. For a while, no one knew where he was. The other day, however, he was sighted alone in the Hrym territory. Seemed he was heading for an allied region.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: Hrym...

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Alone, you say. Was he safe?

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: I'm afraid not... There is a major insurrection happening in the Hrym territory. It's been five years since Duke Aegir lost his control of the area... The military seems to have finally lost control, and the people's violence is unleashed.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: I do not understand. Why are they rioting?

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: It's obvious, isn't it? Ferdinand, do you really know nothing about Hrym? Your own father was ruling it -- you don't know what became of the area once he fell from power?

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: If it was truly a House Aegir territory, I would have been trained in governing the area. But my father insisted that I have nothing to do with Hrym. But now is not the time to talk about this. We have to help him before he gets caught up in the violence.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: You're right. Now isn't the time for chitchat. Let's get over there quickly. Professor, will you be coming?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'll go with you.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: We'd better depart as soon as possible. I know a bit about the situation. I'll fill you in later.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I want you to wait.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: I understand. If you cannot help us, the Knights of Seiros will, so it is not a problem.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: Professor, time is of the essence. If you're going to come with us, prepare as quickly as you can.

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: This is where my father was sighted? The citizens are rioting everywhere.

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: Over there! Quick -- we need to help them!

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: There seem to be some people inciting the violence. If we take them out, perhaps the violence will subside.

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: It might be best to spread out...

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: The north side of the town is in chaos. I do not think we can advance.

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: It seems better to simply hold the line against the enemies to the north, and focus our efforts on saving the citizens in the east and south.

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: Th-thank you! Looks like I won't be robbed this time!

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: Thank you ever so much for helping us! I don't know what would have happened if it weren't for you...

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: We owe you our lives! We're saved! Saved, I say!

battle.speaker: Villager
battle.line: I get to live another day, and it's all because you came to the rescue!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: I think that's all of them. I'm so glad we were able to help everyone.

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: All right! Let's ransack this place!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: Ugh, we weren't fast enough! But there's still time to save the others. Hurry!

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: Oh yeah, keep going! Hahaha!

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: They got past us...again. We have to save the next one!

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: I'll take whatever I want, and there ain't nothing you can do to stop me!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: Ugh, they ransacked another house! But there may be others yet who need our help.

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: All right, boys! Smash and grab whatever's left!

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: We could not save anyone?! It infuriates me to feel so helpless...

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: Oh, looky there, some houses are still untouched! Let's give 'em a good plundering, boys!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: Professor, let's make haste and go help them! Their lives may be forfeit if we don't get to them quickly.

battle.speaker: Rogue Grappler
battle.line: Hyaah! Go on, boys! Riot to your heart's content!

battle.speaker: Rogue Grappler
battle.line: Argh! I'm not the only...bad guy here...

battle.speaker: Rogue Thief
battle.line: What?! W-we give up! Have mercy! That guy made us do it!

battle.speaker: Rogue Swordmaster
battle.line: Hahaha! If we cause enough chaos, we can do whatever we want!

battle.speaker: Rogue Swordmaster
battle.line: My ambition...unfulfilled...

battle.speaker: Rogue Thief
battle.line: We yield! Yield! We were just following orders! It's not like we love a good riot, really!

battle.speaker: Rogue Sniper
battle.line: What do you want?! You'd better not stand in our way!

battle.speaker: Rogue Sniper
battle.line: And after I went to all the trouble of killing that noble and stealing his treasure...

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: Father, no! So, we were too late after all...

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Ferdinand... Hey.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: I... I don't know what to say. About your father, I mean.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: No, it is all right. Some part of me was expecting this. I do not know what happened in Hrym territory, but I'm sure he got what he deserved. You knew more about it, you said? Maybe you can tell me everything later.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: I can tell you what I know.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Please do.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: You know about the Hrym rebellion, right?

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Of course. The rebellion started when Emperor Ionius IX tried to consolidate power. The Hrym family tried to split off from the Empire and join the Alliance. Working with House Ordelia, they raised an insurrection. The Empire suppressed it. And then a puppet leader was installed in the Hrym territory. House Aegir was tasked with handling the actual governance of the region. Seeing this, the nobles feared that the Empire would assume total control. That's when the six great noble families chose to wrest power from Ionius IX.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: That's right. The Insurrection of the Seven. I've always wondered why it was called seven when there were only six noble families.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: It was the six great noble families, plus Hrym.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: How vexing. Either way, events unfolded shortly thereafter. Are you aware of how Duke Aegir was ruling the Hrym territory? He imposed harsh taxes upon the people -- much harsher than on his own -- making their lives very challenging. People fled their homes in droves to the neighboring Ordelia territory. But they were sent back from where they came. The Empire was occupying Ordelia territory as well, as it turned out. Issues were further complicated when Duke Aegir fell from power. Aegir was dismissed from his position, only to be replaced by Lord Arundel.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Edelgard's uncle, the regent of the Empire...

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Correct. And he imposed even heavier taxes on the people, squeezing them painfully dry. The people were conscripted for duty. Any who opposed were killed on the spot. Lord Arundel did this in the name of Duke Aegir.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Your father was by no means a great ruler. But it was Lord Arundel who stoked the fury of the people and directed that fury at your father. Duke Aegir is not perfect, but he's not the villain in this.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Lysithea, thank you for telling me all this. I am embarrassed to say, I had no idea. I see now that it was not his fault. But he did go along the wrong path, and place a burden on his people. He can no longer atone for what he did, so I will have to. I need to go think about what I will do after the war. How I will make up for my father's mistakes.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Nothing helps deep thought like sweets.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: Sweets. They help you think. Perhaps you should find some for us.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: I see. If I find some, I will be sure to let you know.
